exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences using will ('ll) or won't where appropriate.

items.prompt: Complete the sentence with an immediate decision: The door is open. ____ (shut it)
Complete the sentence: I forgot to send the message. ____ (do it now)
Complete the reply: 'What would you like to drink?' ____ (orange juice)
accepted_variants: I will have orange juice, please.

items.prompt: Offer help: That suitcase looks heavy. ____ (carry it)
Promise: Thanks for lending me £20. ____ (pay you back on Friday)
items.canonical: I'll pay you back on Friday.
accepted_variants: I'll pay you back on Friday.
I'll pay you back on Friday
i'll pay you back on friday.
I will pay you back on Friday.

items.prompt: Refuse: 'Can you drive me at 3 a.m.?' Sorry, ____.
Negative decision: It's too late. ____ (not phone him tonight)
accepted_variants: I will not phone him tonight.

items.prompt: Agree: 'Can you send the file today?' Sure, ____.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences. Use I'll / won't / Will you…? as needed.

items.prompt: Ask someone to do something: ____ (you / turn down the music) ? It's very loud.
items.canonical: Will you turn down the music, please?
accepted_variants: Will you turn down the music, please?
Will you turn down the music, please?.
will you turn down the music, please?

items.prompt: Offer: You look tired. ____ (make you a coffee).
accepted_variants: I will make you a coffee.

items.prompt: Agree: 'Can you meet me after work?' Yes, ____ (meet you at 6).
Promise: Don't worry. ____ (not tell anyone).
Refusal: I’ve asked him many times, but he ____ (not listen).

exercises.instruction: Choose the correct sentence in each situation.

items.prompt: You decide right now because the phone is ringing. Choose the best sentence.
You arranged this yesterday. Choose the best sentence.
You offer help. Choose the best sentence.
You already have a plan for Saturday. Choose the best sentence.
options: I'll go to Kyiv on Saturday.
I'm going to Kyiv on Saturday.
items.canonical: I'm going to Kyiv on Saturday.
accepted_variants: I'm going to Kyiv on Saturday.
I'm going to Kyiv on Saturday
I'm going to Kyiv on Saturday..

items.prompt: You make a promise. Choose the best sentence.
You decide now what to order. Choose the best sentence.
This is a fixed timetable. Choose the best sentence.
You ask someone to do something. Choose the best sentence.
options: Will you email me the details?
Do you email me the details?
items.canonical: Will you email me the details?
accepted_variants: Will you email me the details?
Will you email me the details?
Will you email me the details?.

items.prompt: You’ve already decided earlier. Choose the best sentence.
options: I'll have lunch with Nora tomorrow.
I'm having lunch with Nora tomorrow.
items.canonical: I'm having lunch with Nora tomorrow.
accepted_variants: I'm having lunch with Nora tomorrow.
I'm having lunch with Nora tomorrow
I'm having lunch with Nora tomorrow..

items.prompt: Immediate decision: it's cold. Choose the best sentence.
Refusal (the machine 'refuses'). Choose the best sentence.
Arrangement in diary. Choose the best sentence.
options: We'll see the dentist on Monday.
We're seeing the dentist on Monday.
items.canonical: We're seeing the dentist on Monday.
accepted_variants: We're seeing the dentist on Monday.
We're seeing the dentist on Monday
We're seeing the dentist on Monday..

exercises.instruction: Write questions with Shall I…? or Shall we…?

items.prompt: You want to offer to carry a bag. Write the question: ____ (I / carry) your bag?
You and a friend are choosing a restaurant. Suggest an idea: ____ (we / try) the new café?
items.canonical: Shall we try the new café?
accepted_variants: Shall we try the new café?
Shall we try the new café?.
shall we try the new café?

items.prompt: Ask for advice: I’ve got no cash. ____ (I / do) ?
Offer: It's hot in here. ____ (I / open) the window?
Suggestion: We’re late. ____ (we / take) a taxi?
Offer: You look busy. ____ (I / help) you?

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with will / won't (as appropriate).

items.prompt: Complete: Don’t worry about the exam. You ____ fine.
Complete: I’m cold. I think it ____ snow tonight.
Complete: They ____ probably arrive after 8.
Complete: I don’t think he ____ agree to that.
Complete: I’m sure you ____ enjoy the concert.
Complete: If you keep talking, the baby ____ wake up.

exercises.instruction: Make predictions. Complete each sentence with will / won't and a suitable verb.

items.prompt: Finish with a prediction: The sky is very dark. It ____.
Finish: I’m late again. The boss ____.
Finish: That film is great. You ____.
Finish: They’ve missed the last bus. They ____.
Finish: It’s 3 a.m. She ____.
Finish: This box is too heavy. I ____.
Finish: I’m not sure about Tom. He ____.
Finish: The train is usually on time. It ____.
Finish: I haven’t heard from them. They ____.
Finish: The kids are very quiet. They ____.

exercises.instruction: Choose the correct option.

items.prompt: Choose the best sentence for a fixed arrangement.
Choose the best form after hope.
options: I hope it will stop raining soon.
I hope it stops raining soon.
items.canonical: I hope it stops raining soon.
accepted_variants: I hope it stops raining soon.
I hope it stops raining soon

items.prompt: Choose the best sentence for a guess about now.
Choose the better prediction sentence.
options: I think they're going to win (I decided now).

items.prompt: Choose the best sentence to show refusal.
Choose the best sentence for an official letter style.
Choose the best sentence for timetable/fact.
options: The meeting will start at 9.00 on Monday (as scheduled).
The meeting starts at 9.00 on Monday.
items.canonical: The meeting starts at 9.00 on Monday.
accepted_variants: The meeting starts at 9.00 on Monday.
The meeting starts at 9.00 on Monday

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences using shall / shan't where appropriate.

items.prompt: Complete (formal): I ____ be late. (shall / will)
Write a suggestion with shall: ____ we start now?
Write an offer: ____ I carry that for you?
Complete: We ____ meet again next month. (formal)
Negative (formal): I ____ be long. (shan’t / shall not)

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences. Use will / won't, or the present after hope.

items.prompt: Complete: Don’t phone Janet. She ____ be having dinner now.
Complete: I ____ probably be home after 7.
Complete: The door’s locked. Someone ____ have the key.
Complete: I’m sure it ____ get better soon.
Complete after hope: I hope you ____ my message.
Complete: He says he’s sorry, but he ____ change. (refusal)
Complete: It’s quiet upstairs. The children ____ be asleep.
Complete: If you don’t hurry, you ____ miss the train.
Complete: I don’t think we ____ have enough time.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with I'll (I will) or (be) going to.

items.prompt: Complete: 'I’m thirsty.' ____ get some water. (decide now)
Complete: I’ve already bought the tickets. ____ travel on Friday. (plan)
Complete: 'There’s a knock at the door.' ____ answer it. (decide now)
Complete: I’ve decided. ____ apply for that job. (plan)
Complete: 'This bag is too heavy.' ____ help you. (offer now)
Complete: We’ve arranged everything. ____ move house next month.
Complete: 'I forgot your book!' ____ bring it tomorrow. (promise now)
Complete: I’m saving money because ____ buy a bike.
Complete: 'The phone is ringing.' ____ get it. (now)
Complete: She has planned her trip. She ____ visit Spain and Portugal.
Complete: 'I can’t do this maths.' ____ ask the teacher. (now)

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences. Use will or (be) going to.

items.prompt: Complete: Look at those clouds! It ____ rain soon. (evidence)
Complete: I think the team ____ win tonight. (opinion)
Complete: Watch out! You ____ fall. (evidence)
Complete: Don’t worry. I’m sure you ____ pass the test. (opinion)
Complete: The glass is on the edge. It ____ break. (evidence)
Complete: In my view, prices ____ go up next year.
Complete: He’s driving too fast. He ____ have an accident.
Complete: I’m sure you ____ enjoy the party.

exercises.instruction: Write sentences using will / won't or (be) going to.

items.prompt: Write a reply with will (decision now): 'We’re out of milk.' -> ____ (buy some)
Write a sentence with going to (plan): 'I’ve booked the hotel.' -> ____ (stay there for three nights)
items.canonical: I'm going to stay there for three nights.
accepted_variants: I'm going to stay there for three nights.
I'm going to stay there for three nights
i'm going to stay there for three nights.
I am going to stay there for three nights.

items.prompt: Prediction with evidence: 'The dog is growling.' -> It ____ bite.
Prediction (opinion): 'Do you like this song?' -> Yes, I think you ____ like it too.
Offer: 'I can’t lift this.' -> ____ (help you)
Plan: 'We’ve decided already.' -> We ____ start at 6 a.m.
Negative: 'Is Tom coming?' -> No, he ____ come. (decision)
Evidence: 'She’s got her suitcase.' -> She ____ leave.

exercises.instruction: Choose the correct option.

items.prompt: At 8.30 tomorrow, I won't answer the phone because …
By the end of this month, we … the new website.
This time next week, they … in the mountains.
When you arrive at 7, I … dinner.
By 10 a.m., she … all the emails.
At 3 p.m., the manager … the visitors around the office.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with will be -ing.

items.prompt: Complete: Don’t call me at 9. I ____ (drive) to the airport then.
Complete: At this time tomorrow, we ____ (sit) on the train.
Complete: Next week I ____ (work) from home, so I can meet you at lunch.
Complete: This evening she ____ (study), so please be quiet.
Complete: At 6 o’clock, they ____ (have) dinner.
Complete: Will you ____ (use) your laptop tonight?
Complete: I ____ (see) Alex later, so I can ask him.
Complete: The kids ____ (sleep) by the time we get home.

exercises.instruction: Complete with will be -ing or will have done.

items.prompt: Complete: By Friday, I ____ (finish) the report.
Complete: By the time you arrive, we ____ (leave).
Complete: At 9 tomorrow, I ____ (work).
Complete: In two hours, she ____ (cook) dinner.
Complete: By next summer, they ____ (save) enough money.
Complete: This time tomorrow, you ____ (fly) over the sea.
Complete: By the end of the day, we ____ (send) the invoices.
Complete: At 5 p.m., I ____ (meet) a client.
Complete: By 5 p.m., I ____ (meet) three clients.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences. Use the present (not will) after time words.

items.prompt: Complete: I’ll call you when I ____ home. (get)
Complete: Please turn off the lights before you ____ . (leave)
Complete: We’ll start as soon as everyone ____ . (arrive)
Complete: Wait here until I ____ back. (come)
Complete: After she ____ dinner, she’ll wash the dishes. (cook)
Complete: Don’t open the file until I ____ you. (tell)
Complete: I’ll pay you back when I ____ paid. (get)
Complete: I’m going to buy groceries after I ____ work. (finish)
Complete: When he ____ older, he’ll understand. (be)
Complete: We’ll go for a walk if the rain ____ . (stop)
Complete: As soon as I ____ from the meeting, I’ll message you. (come)
Complete: I’ll be ready before you ____ . (go)

exercises.instruction: Complete with the present perfect where it means 'finished before'.

items.prompt: Complete: When I ____ the email, I’ll forward it to you. (receive)
Complete: I’ll let you know as soon as I ____ . (decide)
Complete: After we ____ dinner, we’ll watch a film. (finish)
Complete: Don’t go out until you ____ your homework. (do)
Complete: I’ll come to see you when I ____ some time off. (have)
Complete: She’ll call you after she ____ to the manager. (talk)
Complete: As soon as they ____ the result, they’ll announce it. (get)
Complete: We’ll start the meeting when everyone ____ . (arrive)

exercises.instruction: Complete each sentence with the correct present form.

items.prompt: Choose the best form: I’ll text you when I ____ (get / have got) there.
Choose: When you ____ (finish / have finished), come and see me.
Choose: I’ll do it after I ____ (eat / have eaten).
Choose: When I ____ (see / have seen) Leo, I’ll tell him. (together)
Choose: Don’t switch it on until it ____ (cools / has cooled) down.
Choose: I’ll speak to her when she ____ (comes / has come) back. (together)

exercises.instruction: Complete with if or when.

items.prompt: Complete: ____ I see Dan, I’ll ask him. (if/when = not sure)
Complete: ____ I see Dan tomorrow, I’ll ask him. (expected)
Complete: We’ll stay inside ____ it rains. (possible)
Complete: I’ll call you ____ I’m on the train. (expected)
Complete: ____ you don’t apologise, I won’t help you. (condition)
Complete: I’ll tell you ____ I know the answer. (expected)
Complete: ____ you’re free later, we can meet for coffee. (possible)
Complete: I’ll pay you back ____ I get paid. (expected time)

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with can or can't.

items.prompt: Complete: I ____ speak French, but not very well.
Complete: ____ you lend me your pen for a minute?
Complete: Sorry, you ____ park here. It’s private.
Complete: You ____ use my phone if you need to.
Complete: This room is noisy. I ____ concentrate.
Complete: ____ we sit here, or is it reserved?
Complete: She ____ run 10 km without stopping.
Complete: I ____ come to the meeting tomorrow. I’m busy.
Complete: We ____ see the sea from our balcony.

exercises.instruction: Complete with (be) able to in the correct form.

items.prompt: Complete: I haven’t ____ to sleep well lately.
Complete: I’ll ____ to meet you after 5.
Complete: Have you ever ____ to fix a bike?
Complete: I’d like ____ to help, but I can’t.

exercises.instruction: Complete with could / couldn't.

items.prompt: Complete: It was quiet, but I ____ hear a dog barking.
Complete: I ____ see the sign clearly when I got closer.
Complete: We were in the back row, so we ____ not see the screen.
Complete: She spoke fast and I ____ not understand her.
Complete: When I was a child, I ____ swim very well.
Complete: I was so tired I ____ hardly keep my eyes open.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences. Use was/were able to or managed to.

items.prompt: Complete: The door was stuck, but I ____ open it in the end.
Complete: The fire was small, and we ____ put it out quickly.
Complete: She ____ find my number after searching online.
Complete: The signal was weak, but we ____ make a call.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with can/can't, could/couldn't, or (be) able to.

items.prompt: Complete: I can’t talk now, but I ____ call you later.
Complete: I didn’t have my glasses, so I ____ not read the menu.
Complete: I’d love ____ speak Spanish fluently.
Complete: ____ you hear what he said just now?

Complete: We ____ see the stars last night; the sky was cloudy.
Complete: I’ll ____ to give you an answer tomorrow.
Complete: We finally ____ to book a table.
Complete: In the end, they ____ escape through a window.
Complete: When I was 18, I ____ run much faster than now.

exercises.instruction: Write sentences using could.

items.prompt: Write a suggestion with could: We don’t know where to eat. ____ go to the new bistro.
items.canonical: We could go to the new bistro.
accepted_variants: We could go to the new bistro.
We could go to the new bistro
we could go to the new bistro.

items.prompt: Write a suggestion: It’s hot in here. We ____ open a window.
Write a suggestion: You’re not sure. You ____ ask the receptionist.
Write: Give a possible reason: He’s late. He ____ be stuck in traffic.
Write: Less sure than can: It ____ rain later.
Write: Unreal exaggeration: I’m so hungry I ____ eat a horse.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with could / couldn't.

items.prompt: Complete: Be careful. The floor ____ be wet.
Complete: It ____ get worse, so keep the receipt.
Complete: I’m not sure what to do. I ____ talk to my tutor.
Complete: I’m so tired I ____ fall asleep on the bus.
Complete: He ____ be at work; it’s Sunday.
Complete: The meeting ____ finish early, but I’m not certain.
Complete: I ____ not hear you. The music was loud.
Complete: She ____ be the person you saw — she looks similar.
Complete: The plan ____ change at the last minute.
Complete: He ____ do it yesterday because he was ill.

exercises.instruction: Choose the correct option.

items.prompt: General truth vs this situation: Choose the better sentence.
Specific situation: You’re not sure if the plan will stay the same. Choose.
Suggestion: Choose the better sentence.
Unreal exaggeration: Choose the better sentence.
Possibility now: Choose.
Not possible: Choose.
options: He couldn't be 12; he’s an adult.
He might not be 12; he’s an adult.
items.canonical: He couldn't be 12; he’s an adult.
accepted_variants: He couldn't be 12; he’s an adult.

items.prompt: Advice: Choose.
options: You can talk to the manager.
You could talk to the manager.
items.canonical: You could talk to the manager.
accepted_variants: You could talk to the manager.

items.prompt: Possibility later: Choose.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with could have / couldn't have.

items.prompt: Complete: You ____ told me earlier. I didn’t know! (could have)
Complete: I ____ missed the bus, but I left early. (could have)
Complete: They ____ won, but they played badly. (could have)
Complete: You ____ hurt yourself. Be more careful. (could have)
Complete: It ____ been John. He was abroad. (couldn't have)
Complete: She ____ seen us; she was looking the other way. (couldn't have)
Complete: The keys ____ disappeared. You had them a minute ago. (could have)
Complete: He ____ finished already; he started five minutes ago. (couldn't have)

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with must or can't.

items.prompt: Complete: You’ve been working since 6 a.m. You ____ be exhausted.
Complete: The lights are off and nobody answers. They ____ be at home.
Complete: She knows all the details. She ____ have spoken to Mark.
Complete: That ____ be true. I saw the opposite with my own eyes.
Complete: You ____ be joking. (I’m sure)
Complete: He just said he’s 12, but he ____ be 12. He looks 25.
Complete: This ____ be the right address; the numbers don’t match.
Complete: She ____ be very rich. She owns three houses.
Complete: He ____ be hungry; he’s eaten a huge meal.
Complete: The exam was easy. It ____ be hard for you.
Complete: They ____ be friends; they’ve known each other for years.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences about the past.

items.prompt: Complete: She isn’t answering. She ____ have forgotten about the meeting.
Complete: He ____ have seen you; he was facing the other way.
Complete: They arrived at 9, so they ____ have left after 8.
Complete: You ____ have locked the door. It’s still open.
Complete: The files are missing. Someone ____ have deleted them.
Complete: She ____ have finished already; she started ten minutes ago.
Complete: He looks relaxed. He ____ have had a good holiday.
Complete: That ____ have been Sam. Sam is in Canada.
Complete: I ____ have left my keys on the bus. I can’t find them.
Complete: The window is broken. Someone ____ have thrown a stone.
Complete: She ____ have heard you; the music was very loud.

exercises.instruction: Rewrite using must / can't (and must have / can't have).

items.prompt: Rewrite using must: I’m sure he is tired. -> He ____.
Rewrite using can't: I’m sure she isn’t at work. -> She ____.
Rewrite using must have: I’m sure they forgot. -> They ____.
Rewrite using can't have: I’m sure he didn’t see us. -> He ____.
Rewrite: I’m sure it was a mistake. -> It ____.
Rewrite: I’m sure she isn’t joking. -> She ____.
Rewrite: I’m sure you didn’t hear me. -> You ____.
Rewrite: I’m sure this is the wrong key. -> This ____.
Rewrite: I’m sure he’s the manager. -> He ____.
Rewrite: I’m sure they left early. -> They ____.
Rewrite: I’m sure it wasn’t cheap. -> It ____.
Rewrite: I’m sure she is busy. -> She ____.

exercises.instruction: Complete with may/might (or maybe / may be).

items.prompt: Complete: Where’s Anna? She ____ be in the library.
Complete: It ____ rain later, so take a jacket.
Complete: He ____ not know about the change.
Complete: She ____ not want to come with us.
Complete: ____ we should leave now. (one word)
Complete: He ____ busy. (two words)
Complete: This ____ be the wrong address.
Complete: I ____ be late; there’s traffic.

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences about the past with may/might have.

items.prompt: Complete: She isn’t here. She ____ have gone home early.
Complete: I can’t find my keys. I ____ have left them at work.
Complete: He ____ not have heard you. The room was noisy.
Complete: They ____ have missed the train, so they took a taxi.
Complete: I’m not sure. I ____ have sent it to the wrong email address.
Complete: She looks upset. Something ____ have happened.
Complete: He ____ not have understood the instructions.
Complete: The package ____ have arrived already. Check the mailbox.
Complete: We ____ have met before, but I’m not sure.
Complete: The dog ____ have eaten the sandwich. It’s gone.
Complete: They ____ not have received my message.

exercises.instruction: Choose the correct option.

items.prompt: Choose the correct meaning (possible):
Choose the correct sentence for 'impossible':
Choose the best sentence: I'm not sure who it is.
Choose the best sentence: I'm sure it isn't my phone; mine is on the table.
options: It might not be my phone.

items.prompt: Choose the best: It's possible she doesn't know.

exercises.instruction: Choose the correct option.

items.prompt: Choose the better sentence for a possibility (not a definite plan).
Choose the better sentence (possible rain).
Choose the better sentence (not certain).
Choose the better sentence for an unreal situation.
options: If I had more free time, I may travel more.
If I had more free time, I might travel more.
items.canonical: If I had more free time, I might travel more.
accepted_variants: If I had more free time, I might travel more.

items.prompt: Choose the better sentence (no better alternative).
Choose the better sentence (possible activity at 8).
options: At 8, I will be working. (not sure)

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with might (unreal situations).

items.prompt: Complete: If I knew her number, I ____ call her.
Complete: If I were you, I ____ not accept that offer.
Complete: If they paid more, I ____ stay longer.
Complete: If the weather was better, we ____ go hiking.
Complete: If I had a car, I ____ drive to work.
Complete: If he spoke slower, I ____ understand him.

items.prompt: Complete: Don’t call at 9. I ____ (possible plan: study).
Complete: Tomorrow morning she ____ (possible: meet a client).
Complete: At this time next week, we ____ (possible: travel).
Complete: On Saturday he ____ (possible: work).
Complete: They ____ (possible: stay with friends).
Complete: At 6 p.m., I ____ (possible: have dinner).

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with might as well / may as well.

items.prompt: Complete: The bus has gone, so we ____ walk.
Complete: It’s already late. We ____ stay here tonight.
Complete: I’m waiting anyway, so I ____ read a book.
Complete: Nobody is using this table, so we ____ sit here.
